author: András Antos and Balázs Kégl and Tamás Linder and Gábor Lugosi
title: Data-dependent margin-based generalization bounds for classification
window: attributes were binary coded in a 1-out-of-n fashion. Data points with missing attributes were removed. Each attribute was normalized to have zero mean and 1= p d standard deviation. The four data sets were the Wisconsin breast cancer (n = 683, d = 9), the ionosphere (n = 351, d = 34), the Japanese credit screening (n = 653, d = 42), and the tic-tac-toe endgame (n = 958, d = 27) database. 84
